title: Shots fired at mosque in Bayonne, suspected gunman arrested
text:
French police have arrested a suspected gunman in the southwestern town of Bayonne after shots were fired at a mosque, French authorities said in a statement.

"At 15h30, a man tried to put fire to the door of Bayonne's mosque, the perpetrator fired at two people who caught him in the act," said a statement by the prefecture of Pyrenees Atlantique.

Police arrested the man at his house in the Landes, a department in southwestern France, it added.

The two injured men were evacuated to a hospital in Bayonne, said the statement. They are in serious condition.

French media reported that the suspect is in his eighties.

He had connexions to the far-right and stood as a candidate for Rassemblement National in 2015 in the departmental elections of Landes, the party confirmed in a statement.

He was removed from the party following the 2015 election "for making remarks deemed contrary to the values and political line of the Rassemblement National," the statement added.

Interior Minister Christophe Castaner tweeted he was "angry" at the events in Bayonne and sent his thoughts to those injured and their families.

Marine Le Pen, the leader of the far-right Rassemblement National party, said the attack against Bayonne's mosque was "an unspeakable act that is absolutely contrary to all the values of our movement. These crimes must be treated with the utmost severity."
description: Shots fired at a mosque in Bayonne, suspected gunman arrested.
